data.title: Scherr Max Editor Jerry Rubin
data.meta_description: Berkeley Barb; vol. 4, #26 (#98) June 30-July 6, 1967: Blood Purge by Scherr, Max, editor, Jerry Rubin, Joanne Evers, T. Brennan, Lenny Lipton, et al. and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Newspaper. 16p., folded tabloid underground newspaper, illustrated with b&w photos, local ads, sex ads, articles, news, columns, wear at edges, evenly toned, address label and foxing on front wrap, small section of front wrap torn out with some loss of text, else good on newsprint. Cover story on Los Angeles antiwar protest broken up by violent cops. Cover photo of bloodied protester. Also Jerry Rubin off to be a foreign correspondent for The Barb with his fiancee. Photo of the pair, pre-Chicago.

Newspaper. 20p., folded tabloid underground newspaper, illustrated with b&w photos, local ads, articles, news, columns, toning, very good on newsprint. Continuing cover story on the San Quentin conflicts. Also more on Debray's testimony at Court Martial in Bolivia.

Newspaper. 12p., folded tabloid underground newspaper, illustrated with b&w photos, local ads, articles, news, columns, very good on newsprint. Cover stories on Jerry Rubin running for Berkeley Mayor. Ronald Reagan avoiding the March on Sacramento by flying to Oregon. San Francisco Mime Troupe review.

Newspaper. 24p., folded tabloid underground newspaper, illustrated with b&w photos, local ads, articles, news, columns, evenly toned, wraps edgeworn and beginning to split, else good on newsprint. Cover story on judge Monroe Friedman. Also parole Hassle Splits Cleavers. Hot Flashes page of comix from Avatar parodying classic strips like "Miki Mouse.".

Newspaper. 20p., folded tabloid underground newspaper, illustrated with b&w photos, local ads, articles, news, columns, evenly toned, edgeworn, else very good on newsprint. Cover stories on the nude-ins at several Bay Area beaches and resultant busts (both anatomical and of the Fuzzy kind) replete with lots of photos of nude girls (mostly) and boys. Also coverage of the Limekiln Creek celebration in memory of Neal Cassady who recently died.

Newspaper. 20p., folded tabloid underground newspaper, illustrated with b&w photos, local ads, articles, news, columns, toning, wear else good on newsprint. Cover cartoon of nude hippie girl leading hippie pipe and drum smashing the Pentagon. Jerry Rubin's "Look Forward in Anger!" Nude-in with the Sexual Freedom League, Inc. Presidio protests. The issue numbering for volume 5 got out of whack so we have stated the issue and whole number as printed though these may be incorrect.

Newspaper. 20p., folded tabloid underground newspaper, illustrated with b&w photos, local ads, articles, news, columns, toning, very good on newsprint. Cover story on a double-agent dealing in the Haight. Backers pack the courtroom for Huey Newton. Peace and Freedom Party is What's Happening. The issue numbering for volume 5 got out of whack so we have stated the issue and whole number as printed though these may be incorrect.

Newspaper. 16p., folded tabloid underground newspaper, illustrated with b&w photos, local ads, articles, news, columns, toning, very good on newsprint. Cover story on JFK assassination and below the fold Student Activists take over Sproul Hall. The issue numbering for volume 5 got out of whack so we have stated the issue and whole number as printed though these may be incorrect.

Newspaper. 16p., folded tabloid underground newspaper, illustrated with b&w photos, local ads, sex ads, articles, news, columns, wear at edges, toning else good on newsprint. Cover story on Los Angeles antiwar protest broken up by violent cops. Cover photo of bloodied protester. Also Jerry Rubin off to be a foreign correspondent for The Barb with his fiancee. Photo of the pair, pre-Chicago.
